content: Section 17 the question for most excited about in 2020 should probably be changed to 2021.
the link in section 9 for semver can probably be updated as well, although it has redirection
the link in section 10 description should probably be updated to https://www.rust-lang.org/production/users instead
Hmm thanks!

Updated: English:

  • Changed Section 17 to read 2021.
  • Removed the link entirely from Section 10.
  • Updated link in section 9 to https://doc.rust-lang.org/cargo/reference/manifest.html#the-version-field
Updated: Spanish
I fixed a couple of things in the spanish version (added missing options, fixed links to skip sections and made some minor wording changes)
@Iñaki Garay could you take one last pass on it to make sure I didn't change some specific wording that you chose?
It seems to me sp is ready
Absolutely, I had that intention because there were some non-neutral wordings, but I was on the run so I went straight to the updates
aight, went through it again, 'es' is linguist-with-ocd-compliant

nikomatsakis

Updated: English:....

I see that date in first, top section: Our survey will run to December 16th, 2019. Is that correct date? I suppose no...
Italian version: green light :approved: (just fixed some nickpicks)

Blandger said:

I see that date in first, top section: Our survey will run to December 16th, 2019. Is that correct date? I suppose no...

and, yes, we should probably set a closing date. Or remove that sentence to let us adjust freely

updated Simplified Chinese version. Regarding the end date, based on previous discussion of starting next Thursday and the plan in coordination doc that it runs for two weeks, it seems like it's going to end by 24 Sept?
I noticed that several questions in the English survey are missing in the German translation. Should I add them?
likely yes, unless it was intentionally removed for some reason.
@Blandger I just removed the reference to the ending date from the various translations -- I guess I missed one though. I figured we would say it in the blog post and didn't need to repeat it.
Section 17, 10 and 9 of the The Swedish version has been updated as specified.
Vietnamese version has been updated.
Updated those sections mentioned above for zh-hant version!

Languages we might want to add to the list in the survey:

  • Typescript
  • R
  • Kotlin
  • Dart
  • Perl
  • Julia
German translation has been updated.
Polish translation updated as specified

Ludwig Stecher said:

I noticed that several questions in the English survey are missing in the German translation. Should I add them?

please do! I saw comments to that effect but hadn't tried to verify it (and anyway I couldn't translate them)
@Ludwig Stecher did you add the missing questions?
@tanakakz are you able to update the Japanes version as described here
@Bruno Tavares @Luiz Irber can one of you make the updates to the pt-br version as well? :point_up:
:+1:
Russian version is updated.
I noted it, thanks
Random comment: should section 5 say "Official MacOS installer" instead of "Official OS X installer?"
(Since section 7 says macOS)

There is a section like: Rust at Work, but I don't see anything like : Rust at hobby
Currently I would like to use it at work, but I can't. But I like use it for hobby (pets) project. I don't see clear section for such case. Did I miss something?
Section 16 could have some updates about remote conferences, which are more likely than travelling at the moment :upside_down:
Some small fixes, but PT-br looks good!
@Blandger I think that we just ask a few extra questions if you use rust at work, but if you say "no" you still get lots of questions, don't worry

Luiz Irber said:

Section 16 could have some updates about remote conferences, which are more likely than travelling at the moment :upside_down:

that's...a good point but I don't think we have the time to update it. I guess we can live with tha t:)
I guess we could just remove that section
since everything is so messed up right now
I'll start a topic to survey opinions :)

nikomatsakis said:

Ludwig Stecher did you add the missing questions?

Yes, and I also fixed some grammar/spelling.

Where were you proposed to add these languages, Ludwig Stecher? I know we must have included R at least somewhere because I remember there was a surprisingly large number of users who requested interop with R last year

The question is "If you indicated a desire for increased interoperability, which of the following languages would you want to use with Rust?". The list of possible answers is
C, C++, C#, Clojure, Elm, Elixir, Erlang, Go, Haskell, Java, JavaScript, Objective-C, PHP, Python, Ruby, Scala, Swift, Other
Because other languages can be specified, extending the list isn't strictly necessary (and doing so would be a fair amount of work, since the question appears 3 times in every translation of the survey).
P.S. There are two more questions about programming languages, "What programming languages are you comfortable with?" and "Please rank your top 5 programming languages in terms of preference"
The Japanese version is updated.

Updated: English:

  • Changed Section 17 to read 2021.
  • Removed the link entirely from Section 10.

although it didn't have a date so Section 17 didn't need edits
and I left the sec 9 URL alone since it redirects
"good enough"
ok, I went ahead and updated sec 9 too
Sorry. I haven't had time to get involved and thought it would be ok to catch up during this weekend. I just realized the survey is out reading the announcement.
I believe you can still make changes which will be reflected live
At the very end, on the thank you message, the text links to https://community.rs/ which is broken.
The question What is your experience with other tools you use? [rust-analyzer] was missing in the French survey this year
